alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 10:54PM EDT until June 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey...Camden, Gloucester, and Salem. In Pennsylvania...Berks, Chester, Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1054 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Wilmington, West Chester, Gloucester City, Norristown, Chester, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, and East Norriton. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 340. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 25. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 22 and 23. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 12 and 16. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
